Getting An Upgrade

Options
  • Mark as New
  • Bookmark
  • Subscribe to Direct Replies to This Post
  • Subscribe to RSS Feed
  • Highlight
  • Print
  • Email to a Friend
  • Report Inappropriate Content

‎07-24-2013 01:02 PM

My main computer, not me. 

 

Later today my guru is going to pick up my main computer and install Windows 7.  Since XP will be going away in a year I didn't want to wait until the last minute.

 

I still have my notebook, but won't have access to a lot of my data until probably Friday.  After that both computers will be linked and share everything.  That will be cool.

 

At least I won't be computerless like before so I won't have to go into complete withdrawal.  I just won't have a lot of my links.

 

I'll be glad when it's done but since I'm already using 7 on the notebook I'm sure I'll be happy with the results.

 

Lizzy 

Knowledge is Power!

‎07-24-2013 10:02 PM

lizzylou wrote:

My main computer, not me. 

 

Later today my guru is going to pick up my main computer and install Windows 7.  Since XP will be going away in a year I didn't want to wait until the last minute.

 

I still have my notebook, but won't have access to a lot of my data until probably Friday.  After that both computers will be linked and share everything.  That will be cool.

 

At least I won't be computerless like before so I won't have to go into complete withdrawal.  I just won't have a lot of my links.

 

I'll be glad when it's done but since I'm already using 7 on the notebook I'm sure I'll be happy with the results.

 

Lizzy 

 

Best wishes for a seamless upgrade. I am still on XP on the home PC too. After getting home I found I had to run several cleaner programmes through it (Avast, Superantispyware, Malwarebytes etc) because somehow it got a Trojan in it and was exhibiting weird behaviour.

 

I have starter 7 on the netbook. I'm not looking forward to losing Outlook Express when I upgrade to a later windows; I don't like livemail much.

 

I'd appreciate any tips you can offer for a successful upgrade when it is all over.

Cheers, Alan, Type 2, d&e metformin 2000mg, Australia.
Everything in Moderation - Except Laughter.
There is nothing I could eat I like more than my eyes.
Type 2 Diabetes - A Personal Journey(latest: Fat: The New Health Paradigm)

‎07-25-2013 09:38 AM

Windows  7 is actually a more stable platform than XP, so you should find it a pretty easy upgrade.

 

Windows 8 is really different - and by "different" I mean difficult, ugly, awkward, confusing, and pretty much any other thesaurus entry along those lines.  Microsoft is having to scramble to put together upgrades for it.

 

With Microsoft, it's good to wait a bit after new software comes out before you upgrade.  Some versions are stable; some suck.

Type 2 - complicated by surgery for pancreatic cancer
